organization.fullName: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Multicenter Registry for Assessment of Markers of Early Neurological Deterioration in Primary Intracerebral Hemorrhage
identificationModule.officialTitle: Multicenter Registry for Assessment of Markers of Early Neurological Deterioration in Primary Intracerebral Hemorrhage

leadSponsor.name: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This multicenter observational study will explore the risk factors of early neurological deterioration(END) in patients with primary and to investigate the association between END and outcome.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Neurological deterioration affects approximately one-third of patients with primary intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH) and increases the risk of death and dependency. However, the risk factors of early neurological deterioration (END), such as biochemical parameters, neuroimaging, and systemic complications, are not well documented in primary ICH, and the effective predictors of END is unknown.

This multicenter observational study aims to seek out the risk factors of END in patients with primary ICH and to investigate the association between END and outcome.

primaryOutcomes.description: END is defined as an increase in the total NIHSS score of ≥ 4 points within the first 48 h after admission

secondaryOutcomes.description: LND is defined as an increase in the total NIHSS score of ≥ 4 points between 48h and 7 days after admission
Functional outcome will be assessed with modified ranking scale(mRS).Poor outcome is defined as mRS 4-6 at follow-up
Hematoma volume expansion of at least 6 mL or 33% on a CT scan obtained 24 hours after admission compared with the entry scan.
The quality of life will be assessed with the EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D) scale.
Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ)-9 scale will be evaluated, and higher scores means a worse status.
Telephone Interview for Cognitive Status-Modified(TICS-m) scale will be evaluated via telephone interview.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Confirmed diagnosis of primary intracerebral hemorrhage

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with secondary
* Undergo surgical evacuation of hematoma；
* Presenting contraindications or refusal to MRI
* Is pregnant
* Patients refuse to be followed up for any reasons.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients over 18 years old with primary intrcerebral hemorrhage will be enrolled consecutively.

locations.facility: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine at Zhejiang University
